name: Sculptor
description: You can prepare one room (of any color) at no cost; you must choose a room in the bottom two floors of your hotel board.
notes: If the bottom two floors are full of rooms already, you get nothing from this, I’m afraid

name: Musician
description: Draw 1 staff card from the deck and add it to your hand. Additionally, you can prepare one room (of any color) by paying the normal cost.

name: Composer
description: You get 1 strudel.

name: Tailor
description: You get 1 strudel and 2 krones

name: Flamenco Dancer
description: You get 1 coffee and you can advance 2 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Portrait Painter
description: You get 1 dish or drink of your choice, and 2 krones

name: Photographer
description: Draw 2 staff cards from the deck and add them to your hand.

name: Vocalist
description: You get 1 cake. Additionally, you can play a staff card from hand, paying up to 3 krones less.

name: Architect
description: You can prepare up to two rooms (of any color), paying 1 krone less each.

name: Actress
description: You can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: The actress could use an additional room for her staff

name: Poet
description: You get 1 cake. Additionally, you can play a staff card from hand, paying up to 2 krones less.

name: Jewelry Designer
description: You get 1 coffee and 3 krones.

name: Painter
description: You can prepare up to two rooms: Pay 1 krone less for one of them; if you choose to prepare a second, you must pay the normal cost.

name: Opera Singer
description: You can take a guest from the queue at no cost. Additionally, you can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Dame
description: You can take a guest from the queue at no cost.

name: Duchess
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying 1 krone less.

name: Knight of the Empire
description: No effect.
notes: At least he is worth 3 VP.

name: Landgrave
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying 1 krone less. Additionally, you can prepare one room (of any color) by paying the normal cost.

name: Sovereign
description: Draw 2 staff cards from the deck and add them to your hand. Additionally, you can advance 2 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Princess
description: You can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Countess
description: You get 3 krones.

name: Elector
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying 1 krone less. Additionally, you can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Baron
description: You can prepare one room (of any color) at no cost.

name: Prince
description: You can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: The prince could use an additional room for his entourage.

name: Count
description: You can play up to two staff cards from hand, paying 1 krone less each.

name: Earl
description: You get 1 krone.

name: Baroness
description: Draw 3 staff cards from the deck and play one of them immediately, paying up to 3 krones less. Return the other two cards to the bottom of the deck, in an order of your choice.
notes: If all three cards are too expensive for you, or you don’t want to play any of them, you must return all three to the bottom of the deck.

name: Duke
description: Draw 3 staff cards from the deck and immediately play one of them at no cost. Return the other two cards to the bottom of the deck, in an order of your choice.

name: Apothecary
description: You get 1 krone.

name: Post Councillor
description: You can take a guest from the queue at no cost

name: Privy Councillor
description: You get 1 krone and you can advance 1 space on the Emperor track.

name: Professor Emeritus
description: You can take a guest from the queue at no cost.

name: General
description: You get 1 wine and 3 krones.

name: Senior Councillor
description: You can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: The senior councillor could use an additional room for his secretary.

name: Councillor of Commerce
description: You get 5 krones.

name: Court Councillor
description: You get 3 krones. Additionally, you can take a guest from the queue at no cost.

name: Major
description: You get 3 krones

name: Veterinary Councillor
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying up to 3 krones less.

name: Medicinal Councillor
description: You get 3 krones. Additionally, you can take up to two guests from the queue at no cost. Replenish the queue before taking the second guest.

name: Procurator
description: You can prepare up to two rooms (of any color), both at no cost.

name: Lord High Commissioner
description: You get 4 krones.

name: Senior Legal Secretary
description: You get 1 wine and 3 krones

name: Tezcatlipoca
description: Draw 3 staff cards from the deck and add them to your hand.

name: Capt. Goldhaken
description: You get 1 krone

name: Mr. Horsa
description: You can advance 1 space on the Emperor track.

name: M. Ingalls
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying 1 krone less.

name: Mr. Boydell
description: You can advance 2 spaces on the Emperor track.
notes: Please note: This does not allow you to clear rubble from the track—all staff must stay in the hotel during this game.

name: Mr. Oundo
description: You can play a staff card from hand, paying up to 3 krones less.

name: E. Gizia
description: Select an action space with at least one die and carry out the action as normal, but without taking a die from that space. You cannot boost this action. Staff cards providing benefits for taking a specific die cannot be used, because you are not taking a die with this.
notes: This is not a bonus turn, but part of your current turn, right after sending E. Gizia to a room and collecting all other benefits from him. This does not affect your main action, for which you do take a die, in any way. For your information: We’ve weakened the effect from previous editions, in which you would get an additional turn.

name: M. Polo
description: You get 4 krones.

name: Cramersopholus
description: Draw 1 staff card from the deck and add it to your hand. Additionally, you can advance 2 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Farmer Franz
description: You can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track. Additionally, you can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: Farmer Franz and his spouse could use an additional room for their five children.

name: Brother Uwe
description: You can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track. Additionally, you can take a guest from the queue at no cost.

name: Conductor
description: You can advance 1 space on the Emperor track. Additionally, you can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: The conductor could use an additional room for his colleague.

name: Durgoing
description: Draw 2 staff cards from the deck and add them to your hand.

name: MacLeod
description: You can play a staff card from hand at no cost.

name: Mag. Ferdinand
description: You can advance 3 spaces on the Emperor track.

name: Mr. Moras
description: You can take a guest from the queue at no cost.

name: Debutante
description: You get 1 champagne.

name: Lady Companion
description: You can advance 1 space on the Emperor track. Additionally, you can play a staff card from hand at no cost.

name: Governess
description: You get 1 champagne.

name: Prima Ballerina
description: You get 2 krones. Additionally, you can send up to two dancers to the same or different ballrooms by paying the normal cost.
notes: The Prima Ballerina can book a room or go dancing; in either case, her two friends definitely go dancing.

name: Mannequin
description: n You get 1 champagne. Additionally, you can play a staff card from hand for up to 3 krones less

name: Diva
description: You get 2 champagne

name: Waltz Queen
description: No effect.

name: Khan
description: You get 1 champagne.

name: Tenno
description: You get 1 champagne. Additionally, you can prepare one room (of any color) for 1 krone less.

name: Laird
description: You get 2 dishes and/or drinks of your choice (no champagne).
notes: You can mix and match, e.g., take one cake and one coffee.

name: Maharani
description: You get 1 champagne.

name: Marquis
description: You get 2 champagne.

name: Contessa
description: No effect.
notes: But she is worth 15 VP!

name: Tsarina
description: You can send a dancer to a ballroom for 1 champagne less.
notes: The Tsarina can book a room or go dancing; in either case, her spouse definitely goes dancing.

name: Ambassador
description: You can send a dancer to a ballroom for the normal cost.
notes: The Ambassador can book a room or go dancing; in either case, her assistant definitely goes dancing.

name: Abbess
description: You get 5 krones.

name: Consigliere
description: You get 1 champagne and 2 krones.

name: Admiral Winterbottom
description: You can advance 2 spaces on the Emperor track. Additionally, you can send a dancer to a ballroom by paying the normal cost.
notes: The Admiral can book a room or go dancing; in either case, his lieutenant definitely goes dancing.

name: Impresario
description: You get 1 champagne.

name: Cardinal
description: No effect.
notes: But he is worth 14 VP!

name: Mayor
description: You get 2 champagne. Additionally, you can send a dancer to a ballroom by paying the normal cost.
notes: The Mayor can book a room or go dancing; in either case, his secretary definitely goes dancing.

name: The Beast
description: You get 1 champagne. Additionally, you can prepare one room (of any color) by paying the normal cost.
notes: Note that you lose 1 VP for the Beast.

name: Kapellmeister Palfy
description: You get 2 champagne.

name: C. Inderella
description: You can send a dancer to a ballroom by paying the normal cost. Additionally, you can occupy a room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: C. Inderella can book a room or go dancing; in either case, one of her friends definitely goes dancing—the other goes to bed.

name: Phantom
description: You get 1 champagne. Additionally, you can take a guest from the queue at no cost.
notes: Note that you lose 2 VP for the Phantom.

name: The Beauty
description:
You can send a dancer to a ballroom by paying the normal cost.
Additionally, draw 3 staff cards from the deck and play one of them immediately, paying up to 3 krones less. Return the other two cards to the bottom of the deck, in an order of your choice.
notes: The beauty can book a room or go dancing; in either case, her sister definitely goes dancing. If all three cards are too expensive for you, or you don’t want to play any of them, you must return all three to the bottom of the deck.

name: Medium
description: You get 2 dishes and/or drinks of your choice (no champagne). Additionally, you get 1 champagne.
notes: You can mix and match, e.g., take one cake and one coffee. And you get a champagne on top!

name: Partyer
description: You can send a dancer to a ballroom for up to 2 champagne less.
notes: The Partyer can book a room or go dancing; in either case, his plus one definitely goes dancing.

name: Pope
description: The Pope must move into a room; he cannot be sent to a ballroom. In return, you can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side.
notes: The Pope could use an additional room for his entourage.

name: E. Doolittle
description:
Eliza must be sent to a ballroom; she cannot move into a room. In return, you can send an additional dancer that you must place on the same ballroom space as Eliza. You must pay the cost printed on the space only once (for Eliza only) and you get the row bonus only once.
Afterwards, score 1 VP for each dancer token you have in a ballroom, including Eliza and the second dancer token on the same space.

name: M. Antoinette
description:
Marie must move into a room. Additionally, you can send a dancer to a ballroom by paying 1 fewer champagne per other player in the game. In return, each other player gets 1 dish or 1 drink of their choice (no champagne).
If you move Marie to her room in rounds 1-3, score 8 VP; in rounds 4-5, score 5 VP; in rounds 6-7, score 2 VP.
notes: Marie occupies a room and goes dancing anyway.

name: Lord Mayor of London
description: Immediately score the current ballroom. It will be scored again as normal after the next Emperor scoring.
notes: Of course, all players must participate in this additional scoring.

name: J. Gatsby & D. Buchanan
description: Jay and Daisy must move into a room; they cannot be sent to a ballroom. In return, you can occupy an additional room (of any color) by turning it to the occupied side. Additionally, advance 4 spaces on the Emperor track. Please note that the cost is two of each depicted item.
notes: They prefer to stay in their rooms.

name: Ms. Hildegard
description: Ms. Hildegard must move into a room; she cannot be sent to a ballroom.

name: Dr. Hagedorn
description: Dr. Hagedorn cannot be sent to a ballroom and he must occupy two horizontally adjacent rooms (of the same or different colors).
notes: Dr. Hagedorn requires a double suite. If your hotel doesn’t have one, he’ll wait at his table until you make one available.

name: Mr. Schulze
description: Mr. Schulze can neither be sent to a ballroom nor occupy a room—he stays at his table indefinitely (which is why he has no cost). Instead, he is like a staff card (but he is not considered one) that allows you, once per round, to spend any one item (dish, drink, or champagne). If you do, you can immediately play a staff card from hand by paying its cost, score 1 VP, and advance 1 space on the Emperor track. During final scoring, you do not lose 5 victory points for Mr. Schulze, even though he is still sitting in your café.

name: J. Kesselhut
description: Immediately fill the wine orders of your remaining guests with wine from the supply.

name: Mrs. Kunkel
description: Mrs. Kunkel cannot be sent to a ballroom and she must occupy a room in the bottom floor
notes: If you have no vacant rooms in the bottom floor left, you must make do with one fewer table for the rest of the game and, during final scoring, suffer the negative 5 victory points penalty for Mrs. Kunkel.
